data.shownotes: Note: Radio Broadcast from PBS 106.7 FM in Melbourne for PBS Drive Line.

This performance was as opening act for The Drones. Uh Oh, I Called Mum was not on the written setlist. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist was found in a Facebook photo, only one song is unknown, which was written as "BS" or "BJ". Uh Oh, I Called Mum was confirmed by a review. If anyone has any information on what was played at this show or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

The Reclink Community Cup, first held in 1994, is an Australian rules football contest between prominent Melbourne musicians (The Rockdogs) and community broadcasters (The Megahertz) to raise funds for some of the community's most disadvantaged and vulnerable people. King Gizzard was one of the bands performing as additional entertainment surrounding the football match. In a 2013 Beat Magazine interview for the event, Eric mentions they've only played Footy Footy once for a gag but that they 'probably should' for this set, however no evidence remains that they did. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist may be incomplete. The three songs listed were confirmed by audio/video, but its unknown if any additional songs were played. If anyone has any additional information about this show or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist is likely incomplete. The So Many Things music blog covering Melbourne reported that King Gizzard would be playing their new album Float Along - Fill Your Lungs in its entirely at 4 shows in August. The article also mentions 5 other songs off prior releases being played. A second review linked below confirmed 2 of the other songs were Footy Footy and Black Tooth, but 3 are still unknown. If anyone has any additional information about this show or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.
data.tourname: 2013 Float Along - Fill Your Lungs Preview Shows

data.shownotes: KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist may be incomplete. The So Many Things music blog covering Melbourne reported that King Gizzard would be playing their new album Float Along - Fill Your Lungs in its entirely at 4 shows in August. Most of the songs were confirmed by the setlist photo that consisted of the 8 Float Along - Fill Your Lungs songs plus three more that looked to be written in by the lucky fan. This makes sense since everything after the album debut songs was audience requests. Additional reviews for this show mention some other audience requests. If anyone has any additional information about this show or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

data.shownotes: KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist is likely incomplete. The So Many Things music blog covering Melbourne reported that King Gizzard would be playing their new album Float Along - Fill Your Lungs in its entirely at 4 shows in August. This is the 4th and final of those album preview shows. Let Me Mend The Past, Pop In My Step, Float Along - Fill Your Lungs, and Dead-Beat were also confirmed by audio/video. A review on The Ripe mentions Elbow and Muckraker were played. Audience requests for older songs likely occurred after they played the full album live, but no reports or recordings of those are available. If anyone has any additional information about this show or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.
data.tourname: 2013 Float Along - Fill Your Lungs Preview Shows

data.shownotes: This was a free warm-up show at a private house party in Brisbane preceding a full show later that night at the Big Sound music conference/festival. With no known recording, setlist information comes from an interview in the September 2013 issue of The Brag magazine by an attendee that described the whole set as a 'single song lasting half an hour', that KGLW.net has inferred to be Head On/Pill. available. If anyone has any additional information about this show or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlist@kglw.net.

This show was part of BIGSOUND 2013, Australia's biggest annual upcoming band conference, and possibly the inspiration for launching Gizzfest. This was one of the band's first appearances at a music industry-focused event. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist is likely incomplete. A review by SCENEWAVE of the event mentioned a 17-minute psychedelic song as part of their 30 minute set, which KGLW.net and others assume is Head On/Pill, given the recent setlists and album release. Float Along - Fill Your Lungs was confirmed by a Vine and Let Me Mend The Past was confirmed by photos. If anyone has any additional information about this show or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.
Part of Episode 3 of ABABCd.

KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist is likely incomplete. The Tone Deaf review specifically mentions the five songs listed, but also implies others were played. Photos show Ambrose and Joey on keys, which implies 30 Past 7 was played. Another long song was also mentioned later in the set, and Head On/Pill was confirmed to be played early on, which likely is Float Along - Fill Your Lungs. If anyone has any additional information about this show or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

data.shownotes: This show was a Live-To-Air broadcast, presented by Anita Alphabet & Test Pattern. This was a 3RRR subscriber and doorlist only event. Eyes Like the Sky contained an extra verse; "In the life and adventures of M. O’Brian. Scout, pioneer, gunfighter and Yavapai warrior...". After Evil Man, Ambrose dedicated the set to the Kernaghan family. The live broadcast ended after 30 Past 7, but the band played Let Me Mend The Past, Mystery Jack, and God Is Calling Me Back Home to finish the set. God Is Calling Me Back Home contained a false start. After Mystery Jack, Stu said that they had to cut the set short due to Cookie and Ambrose having band practice for the Murlocs. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is now complete. Thank you to 3RRR for sharing their archived recording of this performance. If anyone has any further information about this show, please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

The band headlined the O’Donnell Gardens Stage. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist may be incomplete. Songs footnoted as "first reported performance" are based on reports from attendees and reports of a hand-written setlist (photo unavailable) with working titles for the songs played (Bit, Math, Bit, Hip Hop, 3/4, Angel and Ghost). Seperately, Stu confirmed they debuted Satan Speeds Up at this show during the June 8, 2023 early show. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlist@kglw.net.

The rest of the setlist for this show is unknown and there are no known audio or video recordings. During Head On/Pill, the projector fell from the ceiling and the audience proceeded to hold it up until a repairman crowdsurfed over to fix it. KGLW.net Staff Notes: Hot Wax and Black Tooth were confirmed by audio/video clips and the remaining songs were confirmed by a written setlist that is believed to come from this show. If anyone has any information on what was played at this show or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

During Head On/Pill, which featured Jay Watson on tambourine, Joey's amp broke to which the band proceeded to quiet down so Stu could ask their sound engineer Travers Chesney if they could both be plugged into his own amp. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist is likely incomplete. Hot Wax and Crying were confirmed by photos and Head On/Pill was confirmed to have been played by the audio/video. This is King Gizzard's first US show and was released through the Official Bootlegger program as Live at Levitation ‘14. The lyrics to I'm in Your Mind and Am I in Heaven? contained alternate or incomplete lyrics compared to the album versions which came out almost 6-months after this performance.

I’m In Your Mind contained alternate lyrics. Before The Wholly Ghost, Stu asks Joey if they should play Angel next which was the working title for Her and I (Slow Jam 2) and Joey says they should play Ghost instead the working title for The Wholly Ghost. Before Her and I, Stu asks the crowd "Do you mind if we play a chilled out jammy one or is that boring?".  This is the earliest recording available for the song, which strongly resembles the studio version, although they are still working out the jam sections.  After, Stu asks if they can keep playing new stuff because "they need practice".  Following Am I in Heaven?, Stu shouts out the opener, Ice Balloons, and gives them a "big extra thank you" for letting them borrow their equipment.

This was the band's final performance on their first North American tour, with Stu telling the audience at one point how it was their "29th time playing" on the tour and they "don't know how to play". data.jamchart_notes: Great high energy Head On/Pill leading into a brief drum segment into an ambient jam with Stu flute playing taking center stage, brought back into high energy Pill.
data.shownotes: Hot Water possibly was played by request, as a fan calls out "Hot Water" before it is played, but the same fan's request for Footy Footy is not granted. Between Slow Jam 1 and Am I in Heaven? Amby says, "That was our slow song. This is our fast song". Am I In Heaven? contained a Head On/Pill tease. Head On/Pill featured a brief semi-drum solo and Stu on flute. Joey ended the show with a shoutout to the headliner, White Fence.

data.shownotes: Head On/Pill featured Stu on flute. Near the end of Black Tooth, a fan fell onto a member of the band. Following Danger $$$, Cavs teased The River. Following the Mind Fuzz suite, Cookie teased God Is Calling Me Back Home. Before How Wax, the band thanked their manager Michelle Cable, who joined them on stage and played maracas. Hot Wax was dedicated to their tour mom, Michelle and all their moms and contained a Life Is Cool tease.
data.tourname: 2014 I'm In Your Mind Fuzz - North America

data.jamchart_notes: This version features an iconic moment where Stu realizes he can sing through his pickups, as well as potentially the first "Am I In Heaven?" quotes in Head On/Pill.
data.shownotes: This was King Gizzard's first show in the UK. Head On/Pill contained Am I In Heaven teases and quotes. This may have been the first time this occurred due to Stu mentioning to the band he has a "real crazy idea" and to "stay with him" before quoting and teasing Am I In Heaven?. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist is likely incomplete. Head On/Pill and Hot Wax were confirmed by the audio/video. data.tourname: 2014 I'm In Your Mind Fuzz - Australia

data.shownotes: Stu, Eric and Ambrose joined Babe Rainbow on stage during their set to jam and Babe Rainbow gave their own rendition of Pushin' Too Hard, a cover of a song by The Seeds. Members of Babe Rainbow returned to the stage at the end of King Gizzard’s set to play Pushin’ Too Hard again. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist is likely incomplete. Eric and Stu's appearance during Babe Rainbow's set and Cellophane, Head On/Pill and both performances of Pushin' Too Hard were confirmed by audio/video. Ambrose's appearance during Babe Rainbow's set and Hot Water were confirmed by photos. If anyone has any additional information about this show or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.
data.tourname: 2014 I'm In Your Mind Fuzz - Australia

data.shownotes: Am I In Heaven? contained a Head On/Pill tease. Head On/Pill contained Am I In Heaven? teases and quotes. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist is believed to be complete. All the songs listed were reported by attendees. The Mind Fuzz suite, Empty, Slow Jam 1, Am I In Heaven?, and Sleepwalker were confirmed by audio/video. If anyone has any additional information about this show or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.
data.tourname: 2014 I'm In Your Mind Fuzz - Australia

data.shownotes: Head On/Pill featured Stu on flute. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show may be incomplete and no recording are available. The songs listed were confirmed based on the attached reviews, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any information on what was played at this show or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlist@kglw.net.

KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist is likely incomplete. All songs listed were reported in the attached review and there are no known audio or video recordings. If anyone has any information on what was played at this show or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

Muckraker was played for the first time since 2013-08-29 (121 show gap) KGLW.net Staff Notes: This setlist is likely incomplete. Am I In Heaven? and The River were confirmed by video, and the rest of the known setlist for this show was confirmed by The Music review. If anyone has any information on what else was played at this show or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist may be incomplete. Robot Stop, Muckraker and The River were confirmed by audio/video and the rest were reported by attendees. Although the band claimed on 2022-06-17 that they first debuted Robot Stop at Bonnaroo on 2015-06-12, the brief audio/video clip of Robot Stop from this performance appears to contradict this. We have chosen to include the song on the setlist despite the band's claim as additional audio/video evidence shows that the band were recording and rehearsing songs for Nonagon Infinity as early as February 2015, as well as Evil Death Roll and Gamma Knife being debuted during the other Gizzfest shows. There is also uncertainty as to whether all new songs have been properly identified, if the songs are in the correct order, and if a complete Head On/Pill was played or only the Pill section. If anyone has any additional information about this show or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

Gamma Knife, Robot Stop and Evil Death Roll were introduced as new songs and all contained alternate lyrics. Evil Death Roll contained a flute solo. After Evil Death Roll, Joey introduced Cavs as "John Henry Bonham". Joey ended the show with a shoutout to Unknown Mortal Orchestra.

KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is likely incomplete. The Mind Fuzz suite, Am I In Heaven? and Pill were confirmed by audio/video. If anyone has any information on what was played at this show or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

Wah-Wah, Robot Stop and Evil Death Roll were introduced as new songs and all contained alternate lyrics. Before Robot Stop, Joey shouted out Australian Basketball player Matthew Dellavedova, who was playing for the Cleveland Cavaliers at the time. Before Muckraker, which was played by audience request, Cavs teased Dustbin Fletcher.

Am I In Heaven? contained Evil Death Roll teases. It's Got Old was performed as an audience request. Robot Stop was introduced with the working title “new new song” and contained alternate lyrics and Am I In Heaven? teases. Head On/Pill contained a flute solo from Stu, Am I In Heaven? teases and quotes and I'm In Your Mind and Cellophane teases.

KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist is likely incomplete. All songs listed were confirmed by audio/video aside from Pill which was reported in the attached review. If anyone has any additional information about this show or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist is likely complete. All songs listed were reported based on a recording of this show which is currently lost. If anyone has any additional information about this show or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

Gamma Knife, Hot Water, Robot Stop & Evil Death Roll all contained alternate lyrics. The River was dedicated by Stu to "my man Wayne."  Muckraker was dedicated to "that guy over there." Am I In Heaven? contained Cellophane & Hot Water teases. Prior to the final Pill section, Joey shouted out sound tech Sam and Stu dedicated “this song and every song that we ever play ever” to Jason Galea.

Gamma Knife, Hot Water, Robot Stop & Evil Death Roll all contained alternate lyrics. The River was dedicated by Stu to "my man Wayne."  Muckraker was dedicated to "that guy over there." Am I In Heaven? contained Cellophane & Hot Water teases. Prior to the final Pill section, Joey shouted out sound tech Sam and Stu dedicated “this song and every song that we ever play ever” to Jason Galea.

This is the second show of the day following a semi-acoustic show featuring Ty Segall & Christian Peslak. Wah Wah and Robot Stop were introduced as a new songs and contained alternate lyrics. After The River, Stu and Joey passed out water and mentioned his fingers had pruned with sweat. Danger $$$ was played at the request of an audience member. Before Am I In Heaven?, Joey and Stu ask for another audience request, only to have Ambrose to interject, “you’ll have what your given.”  Between Heaven and Pill, Stu sprayed the audience with water.

I'm In Your Mind Fuzz featured Stu on flute KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist is likely incomplete. The Mind Fuzz suite, Gamma Knife, Evil Death Roll and Am I In Heaven were confirmed by audio/video and The River was reported in the attached review. If anyone has any additional information about this show or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist is likely incomplete. All songs listed were confirmed by audio/video. If anyone has any additional information about this show or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

data.showtitle: Paris International Festival of Psychedelic Music
data.shownotes: KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show may be incomplete. The Mind Fuzz suite, Hot Water, The River and Am I In Heaven? were confirmed by audio/video and the rest were reported by an audience member. If anyone has any information on what else was played at this show or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

KGLW.net Staff Notes: This setlist is likely incomplete. Robot Stop and Am I Heaven? were confirmed by audio/video and the rest were reported by an attendee. If anyone has any information on what else was played at this show or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

KGLW.net Staff Notes: This setlist is likely incomplete. All songs were reported by an attendee and no recordings are available. If anyone has any information on what else was played at this show or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

Am I In Heaven? contained I'm In Your Mind and Hot Water teases and Cellophane and Sea Of Trees teases and quotes KGLW.net Staff Notes: This setlist may be incomplete. All songs were confirmed by audio/video except for Danger $$$ which was reported in the attached review. If anyone has any information on what else was played at this show or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

KGLW.net Staff Notes: This setlist may be incomplete. The Mind Fuzz suite, Robot Stop and Vegemite were confirmed by audio/video and the rest were reported by an attendee. If anyone has any information on what else was played at this show or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

The show was held on the Lattelecom Stage. Am I In Heaven? contained Cellophane and Head On/Pill teases and quotes and I'm In Your Mind and Hot Water teases. Robot Stop and Evil Death Roll contained alternate lyrics. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete. The songs were confirmed via contemporaneous discussions through various social media and the livestreamed broadcast, but the broadcast starts during the Cellophane teases in Am I In Heaven?. Any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlist@kglw.net.

KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist is incomplete. The River was confirmed by audio/video and the rest were reported by an attendee. If anyone has any information on what was played at this show or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

Am I In Heaven? contained a medley of teases including Cellophane and Hot Water KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist may be incomplete. Am I In Heaven? was confirmed by an audio/video clip and People-Vultures was confirmed by audio/video from King Gizzards BOOTLEG HOLIDAY FROM HELL, which includes dates and venue for each clip in the video description. If anyone has any additional information about this show or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

Her and I (Slow Jam 2) was played for the first time since 2014-12-19 (55 show gap) KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is incomplete. Her and I was confirmed by audio/video and the rest were reported by an attendee. If anyone has any information on what else was played at this show or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is likely incomplete. The Mind Fuzz suite was confirmed by audio/video and the rest were confirmed by the attached review. If anyone has any information on what else was played at this show or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is likely incomplete. Hot Wax was confirmed by audio/video and the rest were reported by an attendee. If anyone has any information on what was played at this show or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist is likely incomplete. Hot Water, Am I In Heaven? and Head On/Pill were confirmed by audio/video and the Mind Fuzz suite was reported by an attendee. If anyone has any information on what else was played at this show or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

Gamma Knife and Robot Stop contained working lyrics. Hot Water was incomplete. After Sleepwalker, a fan asked the band if they could go back to Australia with them, to which Ambrose told them they could "hop in [his] harp bag". Am I In Heaven? contained a medley of teases and quotes from Cellophane, Hot Water and Head On/Pill. Pill contained Am I In Heaven? and Hot Water teases.

Am I In Heaven contained Cellophane teases and quotes and Head On/Pill teases. Head On/Pill featured Stu on flute and Am I In Heaven? and Hot Water teases and quotes KGLW.net Staff Notes: This setlist may be incomplete. All songs were confirmed by audio/video but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any information on what else was played at this show or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist may be incomplete. Head On/Pill and The Mind Fuzz Suite were confirmed by video, while the remaining songs listed were fan reported. If anyone has any additional information about this show or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlist@kglw.net.

Head On/Pill contained Am I In Heaven? teases Poster by Carlo Vivary KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete, but no recordings are available. KGLW.net staff believes the setlist is complete based on contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlist@kglw.net.
Robot Stop, Gamma Knife, and People Vultures were introduced as new songs. Thank you FUZZMAN. for the full recording of this show.

Show Notes: The band walked out to The Nonagon Intro Theme. Head On/Pill contained an Am I in Heaven? jam with lyrics and a flute solo. Robot Stop, People Vultures and Evil Death Roll were introduced as a new songs. After People Vultures, a fan got on stage to crowd surf and was coaxed by Joey. After the River, a fan requests Work This Time and Stu teases it. Thank you to Peter Deckers for the video and Stef Van Alsenoy for the Audio.

Before Head On/Pill, Stu asked the crowd "how about this one?" and teased the intro to Bone. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete, but no recordings are available. KGLW.net staff believes the setlist is complete based on contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlist@kglw.net.

The traditional transition from Cellophane > I'm In Your Mind Fuzz did not occur due to Stu noticing someone being kicked out for crowdsurfing, which prompted him to pause the song and ask for them to be let back in, and then told the crowd to look out for each other. Stu called out Evil Death Roll before The River, which was introduced as a jazz song, implying it was listed before The River on the setlist. Head On/Pill featured Stu on flute. Thank you to Marty Loving for the full recording of this show.

After the Mind Fuzz suite, Stu told the crowd it was Cookie's 25th birthday, followed by the band singing “Happy Birthday to You” and Stu getting him to crowd surf for the first time. Before The River, an audience member requested Footy Footy, to which Joey asked if they even know what Australian football is. Head On/Pill contained Am I In Heaven? teases and quotes. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete. Robot Stop through Evil Death Roll were confirmed via audio/video recordings. The remaining songs were confirmed through contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlist@kglw.net.

Overkill (Motörhead) played before and as the band walked on stage. Twenty seconds into The River, the song was stopped and an attendee who was being removed by security was returned to the crowd at Stu's request. Head On/Pill contained Cellophane teases and quotes. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete. Robot Stop through People-Vultures and Cellophane through The River were confirmed via audio/video recordings. The remaining songs were confirmed through contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlist@kglw.net.

KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete. People-Vultures and Trapdoor were confirmed via audio/video recordings. The remaining songs were confirmed through contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlist@kglw.net.

After Trapdoor, Joey commented that the venue "smells like [his] dad's breath, which is good!". After I'm In Your Mind Fuzz, Stu briefly teased Stressin'. Head On/Pill contained Robot Stop, Evil Death Roll, Hot Water and Big Fig Wasp teases, Cellophane and Am I In Heaven? teases and quotes and a flute solo. Thank you Michael Zelner for the full recording of this show.

Overkill (Motörhead) played as the band came on stage. During I'm Not In Your Mind, a camera recording the band fell over and Joey had to alert an audience member to bring it to a crew member. Head On/Pill featured Stu on flute and contained Robot Stop, Hot Water, Sea of Trees and Rattlesnake teases, as well as Cellophane and Am I In Heaven? teases and quotes. This show was recorded and released as the Live in San Francisco '16 album and concert film.

data.showtitle: Glastonbury Festival Secret Set At The Crow's Nest
data.shownotes:
Head On/Pill was played for the first time since 2016-05-28. (103 show gap)

The setlist for this show is likely incomplete and only partial recordings exist.
Am I In Heaven? contained People Vultures, Cut Throat Boogie, Rattlesnake, Alter Me, Robot Stop, Cellophane, I'm In Your Mind, Head On/Pill, and Float Along - Fill Your Lungs teases and quotes.

Head On/Pill was played for the first time since 2017-06-24. (68 show gap). The intro to Robot Stop contained Trapdoor and Hot Water teases. Head On/Pill contained Sea of Trees teases and quotes, Hot Water teases, Alter Me I teases and quotes, Am I In Heaven? teases and quotes, a Robot Stop tease, and Cellophane teases and quotes.

Vomit Coffin was incomplete, and only one verse of Alter Me I was sung. Robot Stop contained Head On/Pill and Hot Water teases. Head On/Pill contained Alter Me quotes, Cellophane, Sea of Trees, and Am I In Heaven? teases and quotes, and Hot Water and Robot Stop teases
Alter Me III and Altered Beast IV were played for the first time since 2017-12-02. (57 show gap)
The Balrog was played for the first time since 2017-03-24. (133 show gap) I'm In Your Mind Fuzz was played for the first time since 2017-11-23. (66 show gap)

This show featured the debut of Year Of Our Lord. Riff Raff (AC/DC) played as the band came on stage. Cut Throat Boogie was played for the first time since 2017-12-07. (80 show gap) Let Me Mend the Past was introduced as "another old one, from the heart of [Ambrose's] 20 year old self". Eyes Like The Sky was played for the first time known since 2016-02-17. (257 show gap) The Raid was played for the first time known since 2013-11-13. (436 show gap) Only Part I of The River was performed. Wah Wah contained The River teases. Robot Stop contained a Hot Water tease. Head On/Pill contained Hot Water and Robot Stop teases as well as Alter Me, Am I In Heaven?, and Cellophane teases and quotes. After Head On/Pill, Joey thanked all the bands that played at Gizzfest 2018.

data.jamchart_notes: Adam Halliwell (of Mildlife)'s beautiful flute playing adds another layer of sound to this already amazing tease and quote filled Head On/Pill.
data.shownotes: This show featured the debut of Real's Not Real. Evil Star was played through the PA speakers before and as the band came on stage. Hot Water was played for the first time since 2017-10-12 (104 show gap) and featured Adam Halliwell (introduced as the band's best friend) on flute. Following Open Water, which featured a drum solo, Joey pretended to be introducing John Henry Bonham playing Moby Dick. Loyalty featured use of a vocoder for Joey's vocals and Stu on flute. After Horology, Joey thanked openers C.O.F.F.I.N, Bitch Diesel, and "our sexy young lad friends Mildlife". Head On/Pill featured Adam Halliwell on flute, Hot Water, Alter Me. Cellophane, I'm In Your Mind, and Am I In Heaven? teases and quotes, and Robot Stop, Cyboogie, Horology, Organ Farmer, and Rattlesnake teases. This show was released through the Official Bootlegger program as Live in Adelaide ‘19. Poster By Jason Galea Edition of 100

data.jamchart_notes: A notably long "Head On/Pill" with a heavy emphasis on Ambrose's harmonica throughout.
data.shownotes: This show was released through the Official Bootlegger program as Live in Milwaukee ‘19 and featured the debut of Down the Sink. Evil Star was played through the PA speakers before the the band came on. Murder Of The Universe was performed without the Han-Tyumi narration due to an error. After this, Ambrose humorously said "Han didn't like you, sorry.". Mars For The Rich was not listed on the physical setlist. Head On/Pill contained Hot Water, Sea Of Trees and Rattlesnake teases, Hot Wax quotes and Alter Me, Am I In Heaven?, Cellophane and I'm In Your Mind teases and quotes as well as featuring Cavs crowdsurfing multiple times throughout the song. Poster By Jason Galea Edition of 100

Evil Star was played through the PA speakers as the band came on stage. Sense featured use of a Vocoder during part of the vocals. Before Head On/Pill, the Han-Tyumi voice was used to say "Hello" repeatedly, as well as "Thank you", as the band thanked the crowd and opening acts ORB and Stonefield. Head On/Pill contained Am I In Heaven?, People-Vultures, Alter Me, and Boogieman Sam teases and quotes, and Cyboogie, Robot Stop, I'm In Your Mind, Rattlesnake, and Hot Water teases.

Poster By Jason Galea
Edition of 100

Evil Star played through the PA speakers as the band came on stage. I'm Not In Your Mind contained Robot Stop teases. Wah Wah contained The River intro and teases. Cut Throat Boogie contained The Cruel Millennial outro. Head On/Pill featured Rattlesnake, Mr. Beat and Sea of Trees teases, Robot Stop, Hot Water, and Am I In Heaven? teases and quotes, and Hot Wax quotes. Stu played drums for part of Head On/Pill, with Amby on lead vocals and guitar, and Cavs on keys. Cavs also began diving into the crowd and crowdsurfing during the time when Stu was on drums. Muddy Water was on the setlist, but not played. 'Murder of the Universe' and parts of the 'Head On/Pill' jam from this show are featured in the 'Chunky Shrapnel' concert film.

Poster By Jason Galea
Edition of 400

Doom City was on the written setlist after Billabong Valley but was not played. Wah Wah contained a River intro and The River teases and quotes. Head On/Pill contained a flute solo from Stu, Rattlesnake teases and Alter Me and Am I In Heaven? teases and quotes. Stu’s flute solo from the ‘Head On/Pill’ jam is featured in the ‘Chunky Shrapnel’ album. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete, but only partial recordings are available. Venusian 2, Hot Water, Wah Wah, Road Train, Boogieman Sam and Head On/Pill have been confirmed via audio/video recordings. The remaining songs were confirmed through contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net. Poster By Jason Galea Edition of 200

data.jamchart_notes: The first 15 minutes was a more standard Head On/Pill medley and contained many teases, but the last 15 minutes was a big jam featuring ORB and Stonefield. It was featured in "A Brief History of Planet Earth" on Chunky Shrapnel.
data.shownotes: Head On/Pill contained Rattlesnake quotes, Robot Stop, Venusuan 2 and The River teases and Hot Water, Am I In Heaven, Alter Me, and Cellophane teases and quotes, as well as guest performances from Stonefield and ORB members. Parts of the ‘Head On/Pill’ jam are featured in the ‘Chunky Shrapnel’ album. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist is believed to be complete. Most of Head On/Pill was confirmed by audio/video recording. The remaining songs were confirmed via contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net. Poster By Jason Galea Edition of 100

This was the Jams Night show of the Princess Theatre residency, the second of five planned shows, each featuring a different specific genre and preannounced songs. Am I in Heaven? contained Rattlesnake teases, Head On/Pill teases/quotes and Boogieman Sam quotes. Sea of Trees contained Hot Water teases and a jam which featured Stu playing the flute. Head On/Pill contained Am I in Heaven? and Hot Water teases and quotes. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete, but only partial recordings exist. Recordings of Sleep Drifter and Straws in the Wind are unavailable and most other songs are incomplete. The missing songs were confirmed based on the preannounced song lists for each of the 5 planned genre specific shows and contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net. Poster By Jason Galea Edition of 200

Head On/Pill featured Ambrose on sax and Stu playing flute, as well as Hot Water and The Dripping Tap teases and Iron Lung quotes. Rattlesnake contained Doom City teases and O.N.E. and Automation teases and quotes. Am I In Heaven? contained Head On/Pill and The Dripping Tap teases and quotes, as well as The Grim Reaper quotes. During Am I In Heaven?, a cake and flowers was brought out for Cookie's birthday, and both were thrown into the crowd soon after. Self-Immolate and Organ Farmer were on the written setlist after Rattlesnake but were cut. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete. Head On/Pill, The Garden Goblin, Rattlesnake, and Am I In Heaven? have been confirmed via audio/video recordings. The remaining songs were confirmed via the physical written setlist and contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

This show featured the debut of Tetrachromacy. Following Self-Immolate, someone was kicked out of the venue. Persistence contained Head On/Pill teases and quotes. Muddy Water contained Perihelion teases and quotes and featured Ambrose on sax. Head On/Pill contained The Dripping Tap, Persistence, Alter Me, and Blame It On The Weather teases and quotes, as well as Shanghai and Change teases.

Poster By Michael Jager.

Head On/Pill contained The Dripping Tap, Muddy Water, Sea of Trees and Hot Water teases. The Garden Goblin was on the written setlist but was not played. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete. The songs were confirmed via contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

Vomit Coffin featured the now-infamous “Amby Snot Rocket”. Blame It on the Weather was humorously announced as the “complete opposite style of music” to the show-opening Murder of the Universe suite. Work This Time featured a guitar solo. Cut Throat Boogie was announced as a song about Ambrose getting stabbed in the neck with a broken bottle. Wah Wah began with the intro to The River and subsequently featured The River quotes and teases, as well as a jam. Sadie Sorceress featured an additional verse from The Grim Reaper played over the music to Sadie Sorceress. Joey requested the cameraperson zoom in to his face as close as possible during the intro to Self-Immolate and introduced Cavs as “John Henry Bonham”, followed by a drum solo and a “Moby Dick” (Led Zeppelin) tease, plus an additional brief drum solo and “Moby Dick” tease at the end of the song. Before Her and I (Slow Jam 2), the weather was discussed and the band’s ignorance regarding Fahrenheit to Celsius conversions was revealed. The song itself featured a Flamethrower jam, Slow Jam 1 and Magma teases, and a brief Cut Throat Boogie jam. Hot Wax was dedicated to one of the band's sound engineers, Joe Santarpia. Timeland was played over the PA as the setbreak music. Head On/Pill opened with “The Star-Spangled Banner” intro, contained Hypertension teases and a Witchcraft tease, and was unfinished leading into Am I in Heaven?. Venusian 1 closed with a Cavs drum solo which led into Venusian 2. Ambrose introduced Billabong Valley as being about a bushranger and is interrupted by Joey calling him “mad-cunt Morgan”. Let Me Mend The Past, which contained an It Ain't Me, Babe (Bob Dylan) quote, was announced as a song about Ambrose’s somewhat troubled upbringing and was dedicated to Edith, Ambrose’s sister. Alter Me III and Altered Beast IV were performed with Leah Senior providing the narration. Float Along - Fill Your Lungs contained a metal jam. Tetrachromacy and Hypertension were on the printed setlist but cut due to time constraints. This show was released through the Official Bootlegger program as part of Live at Red Rocks ‘22. Poster By Jason Galea Second Edition of Poster

data.jamchart_notes: This mashup of early gizz jams flows between Head On/Pill and Sea of Trees. It also contained improvized lyrics about animals in australia, and plenty of teases such as The Dripping Tap, Ice V, and Shanghai (with jam).
data.shownotes: This show featured Stu singing lines of "Hey man" and lines about different "animals in Australia" throughout. Sea of Trees contained Shanghai quotes, as well as the "Let’s get real high and eat apple pie” quotes that would become Grow Wings and Fly. The return to Head On/Pill contained The Dripping Tap teases. The return to Sea of Trees featured Ambrose on sax. Iron Lung contained an intro jam similar to that of Lava. Sleep Drifter contained Doom City, Honey and Automation teases. Lucas did the vocal intro to Nuclear Fusion at Joey’s request. This Thing contained an “Incredible” (M Beat) quote and Hot Water teases. Slow Jam 1 contained Ice V and Head On/Pill teases, a Hypertension jam, as well as "sexy alien" lyrics with an “Intergalactic” (Beastie Boys) quote and E.T. references. Gaia was introduced as being called "Hey Man" and contained a Magma tease as well as a Motor Spirit jam and featured a drum solo by Cavs. Poster By Drew Millward

This show featured Stu singing lines of "Hey man" and lines about different "animals in Australia" throughout. Sea of Trees contained Shanghai quotes, as well as the "Let’s get real high and eat apple pie” quotes that would become Grow Wings and Fly. The return to Head On/Pill contained The Dripping Tap teases. The return to Sea of Trees featured Ambrose on sax. Iron Lung contained an intro jam similar to that of Lava. Sleep Drifter contained Doom City, Honey and Automation teases. Lucas did the vocal intro to Nuclear Fusion at Joey’s request. This Thing contained an “Incredible” (M Beat) quote and Hot Water teases. Slow Jam 1 contained Ice V and Head On/Pill teases, a Hypertension jam, as well as "sexy alien" lyrics with an “Intergalactic” (Beastie Boys) quote and E.T. references. Gaia was introduced as being called "Hey Man" and contained a Magma tease as well as a Motor Spirit jam and featured a drum solo by Cavs. Poster By Drew Millward

This show featured the debut of Witchcraft. This was “Drag Night”, in which the full band wore dresses and makeup in celebration of Tennessee’s “Adult Entertainment Act” (AKA anti-drag show law) being found unconstitutional by a federal judge. Rattlesnake contained Minimum Brain Size teases and was followed by a quote of “Signed, Sealed, Delivered (I’m Yours)” (Stevie Wonder) by Amby. Straws In The Wind contained a Swan Song quote. Gaia contained Motor Spirit quotes and teases. Boogieman Sam contained quotes of “Going Up the Country” (Canned Heat), “My Babe” (Little Walter) and “Got My Mojo Working” (Ann Cole). Following Magma, Joey announced that he and Cookie had been working on their flatpicking to play bluegrass and jokingly asked where Billy Strings was. Lava contained an “Unknown Legend” (Neil Young) tease. Head On/Pill contained Hot Water teases and Am I In Heaven? teases. Evil Death Roll was on the printed setlist but was not played. Poster By Jason Galea 560 Standard/ 150 Foil Print

Head On/Pill contained Witchcraft teases, Ice V teases and a Motor Spirit jam. Ice V contained Witchcraft teases. Hypertension contained teases of The Dripping Tap, Am I In Heaven? and People-Vultures. The Grim Reaper contained quotes of Torture Chamber, "Intergalactic” (Beastie Boys) and “Sabotage” (Beastie Boys). Poster by Bassant Ahmed

This was King Gizzard's first show in South America. Head On/Pill contained Robot Stop teases and Am I In Heaven? teases & quotes.  Robot Stop contained Hot Water teases & quotes.  Venusian 2 contained Converge quotes.

Ambrose joined fellow Wide Awake act C.O.F.F.I.N. on harmonica during their set. Cheryl Waters (of KEXP) introduced the band as they came on stage. This Thing contained an “Incredible” (M Beat) quote. Evil Death Roll contained Motor Spirit and The Silver Cord quotes. Head On/Pill [1] contained a Hypertension jam with lyrics. Head On/Pill [2] contained Chang'e (Extended) and Witchcraft jams with lyrics, Sea of Trees, Witchcraft, Motor Spirit, and Am I In Heaven? teases and quotes.

Ambrose joined fellow Wide Awake act C.O.F.F.I.N. on harmonica during their set. Cheryl Waters (of KEXP) introduced the band as they came on stage. This Thing contained an “Incredible” (M Beat) quote. Evil Death Roll contained Motor Spirit and The Silver Cord quotes. Head On/Pill [1] contained a Hypertension jam with lyrics. Head On/Pill [2] contained Chang'e (Extended) and Witchcraft jams with lyrics, Sea of Trees, Witchcraft, Motor Spirit, and Am I In Heaven? teases and quotes.

Theia contained The Silver Cord quotes and Motor Spirit teases. Ambrose referenced "four fried chickens, and a Coke" from The Blues Brothers because he was eating chicken and quoted Rock Around the Clock (Bill Haley & His Comets) before Evil Death Roll. The song itself contained Theia quotes. Muddy Water contained the drums from The Bitter Boogie as well as quotes. The Bitter Boogie contained the drums from Muddy Water, quotes of Field of Vision with the lyrics changed to "Field of Chicken", altered lyrics to reference chicken, and a Muddy Water outro. Raw Feel was introduced as a song about the feeling of putting your hand into a bag of fried chicken. Cavs teased Rock and Roll and Moby Dick (Led Zeppelin) before Field of Vision, which had its lyrics changed to Field of Chicken. Hell was introduced as a song about planet Earth. Hot Wax was on the printed setlist before Hell, but was skipped. Shook Ones, Part II (Mobb Deep) was referenced by Ambrose before Head On/Pill. Head On/Pill contained The Dripping Tap and Chang'e teases and featured Ambrose on sax.

Poster by Jason Galea
Standard Edition - 500
Foil Edition - 150

data.jamchart_notes: added to setlist during show, Amby on Sax, various teasing/quoting/jamming
data.shownotes:
Robot Stop featured Ambrose on saxophone and contained Sad Pilot, Converge, and Witchcraft teases. Gamma Knife contained a Motor Spirit tease. People-Vultures contained Iron Lung teases & quotes. Mr. Beat contained Sad Pilot teases. Sad Pilot was introduced as a song about donkeys and dedicated to band soundman Joe Santarpia.  Rats in the Sky was introduced as a song about chickens in the sky. Cut Throat Boogie contained The Bitter Boogie teases and was dedicated to Magic Sam. You Can Be Your Silhouette was dedicated to Alex Brettin of Mild High Club, who then briefly appeared on stage. The Fourth Colour contained quotes of Gila Monster and Mars For the Rich. Straws In the Wind contained a Rattlesnake quote. Welcome to An Altered Future was played for the first time since 2018-03-16. (304 show gap) This was also the first time the suite was performed in full. Set featured Joey on guitar and Ambrose on saxophone. Head On/Pill was not on the written setlist and featured Ambrose on saxophone and contained Am I In Heaven? and Robot Stop teases, Chang'e teases and quotes, and a Hot Water jam with lyrics. At the end of the show, Ambrose thanked Chicago for The Blues Brothers and blues music.

Poster by Jason Galea
Standard Edition - 1200
Foil Edition - 300
data.venuename: Huntington Bank Pavilion at Northerly Island

data.shownotes: This show featured the debut of both Grow Wings and Fly and Treaty (Yothu Yindi). Head On/Pill contained The Land Before Timeland, Chang’e, Am I In Heaven? and Sad Pilot teases and Grow Wings and Fly quotes. Following Head On/Pill, Stu and Joey mentioned that the first show they played outside of Australia was in Austin 10 years ago (2014-5-2). Wah Wah contained an intro, quote, and jam of The River, as well as Ice V teases. Before Nuclear Fusion, Joey noted that Cavs was a big fan of Ferrari so he was happy about them playing inside an F1 track, then talked about how Cavs won a go kart race before the show and announced that it was Mystery Jack's 100th King Gizzard show. A fan, Ethan, was brought up to do the vocal intro to Nuclear Fusion, and he quoted Straws In The Wind before the line. Straws In The Wind contained Phantom Island quotes. Set contained an Ain't It Funky Now (James Brown) tease. During Shanghai Cavs hit his gong and it cracked. Mars For The Rich contained a false start due to the band starting without Lucas. During Treaty, the band were joined by Stuart Kellaway of Yothu Yindi on bass and all of the members of King Stingray. Her and I (Slow Jam 2) was on the printed setlist after Le Risque but was cut. Joey joined opener King Stingray on a cover of Waru (Fire) by Warumpi Band.

Lucas' kid Monty was brought on stage before the show. Gaia featured a short drum solo by Cavs. Following the conclusion of Gaia Cookie quoted In the Jailhouse Now (Jimmie Rodgers) with lyrics changed to "in the big house now."  1 Thing (Amerie) was quoted before This Thing. Ambrose was given a police cap during Field of Vision which he wore for the rest of the song and engaged in police related antics with band photographer Maclay Heriot. Sad Pilot contained an Antarctica tease, teases of Head On/Pill and Hot Water, and a tease of The River. Gamma Knife contained Motor Spirit teases.  Before Work This Time Ambrose quoted Work It (Missy Elliott).  Shanghai contained Grow Wings and Fly teases and Slow Jam 1 quotes. Slow Jam 1 was performed in an alternate synth version for the first time and featured Ambrose on saxophone.  Swan Song was unfinished, contained Slow Jam 1 quotes and Shanghai teases and was followed by a My Generation (Limp Bizkit) tease by Cavs.  Head On/Pill featured Ambrose playing "slide harmonica" on Stu's guitar and Lewis Stiles of King Stingray drumming with Cavs, and contained Sea of Trees quotes.
data.soundcheck: Gamma Knife, Iron Lung (partial), Slow Jam 1 (synth version), Shanghai, Work This Time (no jam), Sleepwalker (partial), Magenta Mountain (partial)

data.shownotes: This show was played with The Queensland Symphony Orchestra conducted by Chad Kelly.  Intermission Jam contained The Land Before Timeland teases.  Head On/Pill contained The Dripping Tap teases.
